title: What is GST?
desc: GST stands for Goods and Services Tax, a single indirect tax on the supply of goods and services across India.

title: Who needs to register for GST?
desc: Businesses with turnover exceeding ₹20 lakhs (₹10 lakhs for special category states) must register.

title: How do I register for GST?
desc: Registration can be done online on the GST portal with required documents.

title: What are the GST rates in India?
desc: GST rates vary from 0% to 28% depending on the goods or services.

title: When is GST filing due?
desc: Monthly returns are usually due on the 20th of the following month, but dates may vary.

title: What is GSTR-1?
desc: GSTR-1 is a monthly return for reporting outward supplies of goods and services.

title: Can I claim an input tax credit under GST?
desc: Yes, provided the purchase is for business use and the supplier has filed their return.

title: What happens if I don't file GST returns on time?
desc: Late fees, interest on tax dues, and suspension of GST registration may apply.

title: How do I pay GST online?
desc: GST can be paid through the GST portal using net banking, credit/debit cards, or UPI.

title: Can GST returns be revised?
desc: No, GST returns cannot be revised once filed, but corrections can be made in subsequent returns.

title: What is GST composition scheme?
desc: A simplified tax scheme for small businesses with a turnover of up to ₹1.5 crore.

title: Is GST applicable on exports of goods and services?
desc: Exports are generally zero-rated under GST.

title: Do I need separate GST registrations for multiple business locations?
desc: Yes, separate registrations are required for each state where your business operates.

title: What is e-invoicing under GST?
desc: It is the generation of electronic invoices for businesses with turnover above a specified limit.

title: How do I track the status of my GST refund?
desc: GST refund status can be tracked on the GST portal using the ARN (Application Reference Number).
